english: to make; manufacture; system; to control

etymology.type: 制: Ideogrammic compound (会意); 製: Ideogrammic compound and phono-semantic compound (形声).
etymology.description: 制: 木 “tree” + 刀 “knife” — to cut a tree; 木 also written as 未. 製: phonetic 制 + semantic 衣 “clothes”.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicts cutting wood with a knife, which extends to shaping, making, and exerting control. The traditional 製 adds the clothing component to indicate making garments, with 制 providing sound and related sense, and the word broadened to general manufacturing.
etymology.simplification: Simplified Chinese merged 製 into 制 by dropping the semantic 衣 and retaining the phonetic 制 for a simpler, already common form; meanings are disambiguated by context.

examples.chinese: 这家工厂制造高质量的手机(這家工廠製造高質量的手機)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā gōngchǎng zhìzào gāo zhìliàng de shǒujī.

examples.chinese: 他们制定了新的评估制度(他們制定了新的評估制度)。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen zhìdìng le xīn de pínggū zhìdù.
examples.english: They formulated a new evaluation system.

examples.chinese: 他终于控制住了局面(他終於控制住了局面)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhōngyú kòngzhì zhù le júmiàn.
examples.english: He finally brought the situation under control.
